title: (x) Bold bouncing caps / The Replacement's 'Pleased to Meet Me' - probably hand-lettered/various alternatives {gang}
content:
Anyone know the typeface from the cover art of The Replacement's 'Pleased to Meet Me"?

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140302040619im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pleased_6092.jpg)
author: lapvance

comments.content:
Reminds me of some of the House Industries sets, like Benguiat Interlock or the Shag family. Also resembles [P22 Nudgewink](http://web.archive.org/web/20140302040619/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-nudgewink-pro/), if nothing closer is found.

- Mike Yanega
I would say that this is lettering.

What Mike and Tomi have said.  
More alternatives:  
 [Various faces by Pink Broccoli](http://web.archive.org/web/20140302040619/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?search=action&category=1260&keywords=all&sortkey=order&sortorder=descending&sortby=recent), [Font Diner’s Motel King](http://web.archive.org/web/20140302040619/http:/www.fontdiner.com/menu_cfp.html), [Rian Hughes’ Klickclack](http://web.archive.org/web/20140302040619/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/device_fonts/klickclack/?&sample_text=PLEASED%20TO%20MEET%20ME), [Retype’s Barbieri](http://web.archive.org/web/20140302040619/http:/www.re-type.com/fonts/fonts-barbieri.html).  
F
